body.p:
Your Petitioner A. J. Hand Jun., states that he was fined fifty Dollars for carring consealed wepons by the Pendleton Circuit Court. at its April term 1861 that a copas has gone against him. for said fine it is true that he did carry said wepon but the Reson he did so was to protect. his person from a thretend assault of one Wm Ray. who was carring a Lage Colts Revolver with the avoded purpos of killing your petitioner which he had been informed of & was advised to carry wepons for his defence he states that if he had of been at court he would have been able to prove all of said acts by A. J. Hand Sen F M Fuget & A G Roberts Esq. who know of the said Ray. Carring said pistol for him but his wife was confined at the time of Court. so that he could not leve home. & his Atty advised him to attend to his
Famaly. & depend on the Exetive Clemency. he filed the affidavit of Hand & Roberts Fuget being in the Southren Army. & he cannot obtain his affidavit wherefore he prays that your Exelency will pardon Remit said fine.
Sworn to before me by A J. Hand Jr this 6th day of August 1861

Harvey Smith
J p p C
We the undersigned Joine in the prayer in the above Petition for the Remission of the above fine

E. A. W. Roberts
J A Grurwell
Joseph Dougherty
Abalom Dilworth
X C Moart
C. Duncan
J. M. Curry
